## Executive Summary

This document outlines the user stories for the [object Object] project. User stories are short, simple descriptions of a feature told from the perspective of the person who desires the new capability, usually a user or customer of the system.  Because no project description is provided, the following user stories are examples and should be replaced with actual project requirements.

**Key User Stories Identified:**
- 6 user stories across 3 categories
- Priority levels: High, Medium, Low
- Estimated effort:  Not specified


---

## User Story Format

Each user story follows the standard format:

**As a [user type], I want [functionality] so that [benefit/value].**

### Acceptance Criteria
Each user story includes:
- **Given:** The initial context or preconditions
- **When:** The action or trigger
- **Then:** The expected outcome or result

---

## Epic 1: User Authentication

### User Story 1.1: Secure Login
**As a** registered user  
**I want** to log in securely using my username and password  
**So that** I can access my account and its features.

**Priority:** High  
**Story Points:** 3  
**Sprint:** 1

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given I am on the login page
- When I enter my correct username and password
- Then I am successfully logged in and redirected to my dashboard.
- Given I am on the login page
- When I enter an incorrect username or password
- Then I receive an error message indicating incorrect credentials.

**Dependencies:** None  
**Notes:**  Consider implementing two-factor authentication in future sprints.


---

### User Story 1.2: Password Reset Functionality
**As a** registered user  
**I want** to be able to reset my password if I forget it  
**So that** I can regain access to my account.

**Priority:** Medium  
**Story Points:** 5  
**Sprint:** 2

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given I am on the login page
- When I click the "Forgot Password" link
- Then I am presented with a password reset form.
- Given I have received a password reset email
- When I follow the link in the email and enter a new password
- Then my password is successfully updated.


**Dependencies:** User Story 1.1  
**Notes:**  Ensure the password reset email is sent securely.


---

## Epic 2: Data Entry

### User Story 2.1: Add New Data Entry
**As a** authorized user  
**I want** to be able to add new data entries  
**So that** I can maintain up-to-date information.

**Priority:** High  
**Story Points:** 8  
**Sprint:** 1

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given I am on the data entry page
- When I fill in all required fields and click "Submit"
- Then the new data entry is saved successfully and I receive confirmation.
- Given I am on the data entry page
- When I try to submit the form with missing required fields
- Then I receive an error message indicating missing fields.

**Dependencies:** None  
**Notes:**  Data validation should be implemented to ensure data integrity.


---

### User Story 2.2: Edit Existing Data Entry
**As a** authorized user
**I want** to be able to edit existing data entries
**So that** I can correct mistakes or update information.

**Priority:** Medium
**Story Points:** 5
**Sprint:** 2

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given I am viewing an existing data entry
- When I click "Edit"
- Then I can modify the fields and save the changes.
- Given I have made changes to a data entry
- When I click "Save"
- Then the changes are saved and I receive confirmation.

**Dependencies:** User Story 2.1
**Notes:** Implement appropriate authorization checks to prevent unauthorized edits.


---

## Epic 3: Reporting

### User Story 3.1: Generate Reports
**As a** authorized user  
**I want** to be able to generate reports on the data  
**So that** I can analyze trends and make informed decisions.

**Priority:** Low  
**Story Points:** 5  
**Sprint:** 3

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given I am on the reporting page
- When I select the desired report parameters and click "Generate"
- Then the report is generated and displayed.
- Given the report is generated
- When I select to download the report
- Then I can download the report in a chosen format (e.g., CSV, PDF).


**Dependencies:** User Story 2.1  
**Notes:**  Consider adding different report types based on user feedback.

---

|------|-------|----------|--------|--------|--------|

| Data Entry | Edit Existing Data Entry | Medium | 5 | 2 | Not Started |
| Reporting | Generate Reports | Low | 5 | 3 | Not Started |

## Definition of Done

Each user story must meet the following criteria before being considered complete:

- [ ] All acceptance criteria are met
- [ ] Code is written and reviewed
- [ ] Unit tests are written and passing
- [ ] Integration tests are written and passing
- [ ] Documentation is updated
- [ ] Product Owner acceptance
- [ ] Stakeholder sign-off

---

## Sprint Planning Notes

### Sprint 1 Goals
- Complete User Authentication (Login)
- Implement basic Data Entry functionality

### Capacity Planning
- **Team Velocity:** 15 story points per sprint
- **Sprint Duration:** 2 weeks
- **Team Capacity:** 30 story points

---

## Risk Assessment

| Risk | Impact | Probability | Mitigation |
|------|--------|------------|------------|
| Insufficient user testing | Delayed launch | Medium | Increased user testing and feedback cycles |
| Unexpected technical challenges | Project delays | Low | Proactive risk mitigation planning and contingency measures |
| Lack of stakeholder buy-in | Reduced project scope | High | Regular stakeholder communication and engagement |


---

## Appendices

### A. User Story Template
```
**As a** [user type]  
**I want** [functionality]  
**So that** [benefit/value]

**Priority:** [High/Medium/Low]  
**Story Points:** [1-8]  
**Sprint:** [Sprint number]

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given [precondition]
- When [action]
- Then [expected result]

**Dependencies:** [other stories or tasks]  
**Notes:** [additional information]
```

### B. Story Point Estimation Guide
- **1 Point:** Very simple, minimal effort
- **2 Points:** Simple, well-understood
- **3 Points:** Moderate complexity
- **5 Points:** Complex, requires investigation
- **8 Points:** Very complex, high uncertainty
- **13+ Points:** Epic, needs to be broken down
